comments:
Build ID: M20070212-1330

Steps To Reproduce:
1.Create a repostiory with mylar trac test settings
2.Click "Validate Settings" dialog 
3.View error - Internal error validating repository
Could not initialise class org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpClient



More information:
eclipse.buildId=M20070212-1330
java.version=1.6.0_01
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=en_GB
Framework arguments:  - vm C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_11\bin
Command-line arguments:  -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86 - vm C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_11\bin

Error
Wed May 30 22:40:56 BST 2007
Internal error validating repository

java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: Could not initialize class org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpClient
at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.trac.core.TracWebClient.<init>(TracWebClient.java:70)
at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.trac.core.TracClientFactory.createClient(TracClientFactory.java:30)
at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.trac.ui.wizard.TracRepositorySettingsPage$TracValidator.validate(TracRepositorySettingsPage.java:215)
at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.trac.ui.wizard.TracRepositorySettingsPage$TracValidator.run(TracRepositorySettingsPage.java:193)
at org.eclipse.mylar.tasks.ui.wizards.AbstractRepositorySettingsPage$15.run(AbstractRepositorySettingsPage.java:1050)
at org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext$ModalContextThread.run(ModalContext.java:113)
Tried a fresh install of Eclipse with just Mylar installed and it worked like a charm.  I disabled Subclipse's Mylar Integration on m original eclipse set up and it solved the problem!
Thanks for posting the resolution. You can also try running 'eclipse -clean' after changing the Eclipse configuration.
The problem was likely a partial install, which prior to Eclipse 3.3RC1 the update manager would allow if "Search for updates" was used instead of "Search for new features".
